module.name: Kelvin 1-wire temperature module
module.description: This module can report temperature from up to eight temperature sensors plus show tempertature for one sensor that is located localy on board.

firmware.description: Firmware version 1.0.0 for the Kelvin 1-wire module for boards with PIC18F2580.
Firmware version 1.0.0 for the Kelvin 1-wire module for boards with PIC18F267k80.

manual.description: Full manual for the Kelvin 1-wire module.

reg.description: Zone this module belongs to

reg.description: Subzone this module belongs to

reg.name: LowControlRegisterSensor0
reg.description:
Low control register for sensor 0.
 In the sensor control register you can set functionality for the measurements of temperature 0.
 Bit 0: Unit for temperature presentation (0=Kelvin, 1=Celsius, 2=Fahrenheit).
 Bit 1: Unit for temperature presentation (0=Kelvin, 1=Celsius, 2=Fahrenheit).
 Bit 2: Reserved.
 Bit 3: Enable low alarm if set to 1.
 Bit 4: Enable high alarm if set to 1
 Bit 5: Send TurnOn/TurnOff events instead of alarm events.
 Bit 6: Invert TurnOn/TurnOff sending.
 Bit 7: Continuous alarm events.

bit.name: Temperature unit
bit.description:
The module can present the temperatures in different units. Default is degrees Celsius but you can select Kelvin or Fahrenheit instead.
 Set to 0 to set unit to Kelvin.
 Set to 1 to set unit to Celsius.
 Set to 2 to set unit to Fahrenheit.

item.name: Kelvin
item.description: Temperature is presented using Kelvin as unit,

item.name: Celsius
item.description: Temperature is presented using Celsius as unit,

item.name: Kelvin
item.description: Temperature is presented using Fahrenheit as unit,

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved

bit.name: Enable low alarm.
bit.description: Enable sending of low alarm events by setting this bit to one.

bit.name: Enable high alarm.
bit.description: Enable sending of high alarm events by setting this bit to one.

bit.name: Send TurnOn/TurnOff.
bit.description: Send TurnOn/TurnOff events instead of Alarm events by setting this bit to one. Bit 6 control when TurnOn/TurnOff events are sent.

bit.name: Controls when TurnOn/TurnOff events will be sent (if activated).
bit.description: 0 - TurnOn event is sent when low temperature is reached as set in low temperature alarm register. TurnOff event is sent when high temperature is reached as set in high temperature alarm register.\n 1 - TurnOff event is sent when low temperature is reached as set in low temperature alarm register. TurnOn event is sent when high temperature is reached as set in high temperature alarm register.\n The hysteresis value will effect TurnOn/TurnOff events The temperature must go above or below the hysteresis value before a new event will be sent out.

bit.name: Continuous alarm events.
bit.description: If this bit is set Alarm events will be sent continuous with a one second interval until the alarm register is read or the temperature goes to a non alarm state (with hysteresis taken into account). TurnOn/TurnOff events will not be affected by a cleared alarm register and will be sent until this bit is cleared or the temperature goes to a non alarm state (with hysteresis taken into account.

reg.name: HighControlRegisterSensor0
reg.description:
High control register for sensor 0.
 In the high sensor control register you can set functionality for the measurements of temperature 0.
 Bit 0: Report format (0=Integer, 1=Float, 2=String).
 Bit 1: Report format (0=Integer, 1=Float, 2=String).
 Bit 2: Reserved.
 Bit 3: Reserved.
 Bit 4: Reserved.
 Bit 5: Reserved.
 Bit 6: Reserved.
 Bit 7: Reserved.

bit.name: Report format
bit.description:
The module can present the temperatures in different formats. Default is as a float but you can select a normalised integer or a string instead.
 Set to 0 to set unit to Normalised integer.
 Set to 1 to set unit to Floating point (default).
 Set to 2 to set unit to String.

item.name: NormalisedInteger
item.description: Temperature is presented using a normalised integer value.

item.name: Float
item.description: Temperature is presented using a floating point value (default)

item.name: String
item.description: Temperature is presented using a string value.

 Bit 1: Unit for temperature presentation (0=Kelvin, 1=Celsius, 2=Fahrenheit).
 Bit 2: Reserved.
 Bit 3: Enable low alarm if set to 1.
 Bit 4: Enable high alarm if set to 1
 Bit 5: Send TurnOn/TurnOff events instead of alarm events.
 Bit 6: Invert TurnOn/TurnOff sending.
 Bit 7: Continuous alarm events.

bit.name: Temperature unit
bit.description:
The module can present the temperatures in different units. Default is degrees Celsius but you can select Kelvin or Fahrenheit instead.
 Set to 0 to set unit to Kelvin.
 Set to 1 to set unit to Celsius.
 Set to 2 to set unit to Fahrenheit.

item.name: Kelvin
item.description: Temperature is presented using Kelvin as unit,

item.name: Celsius
item.description: Temperature is presented using Celsius as unit,

item.name: Kelvin
item.description: Temperature is presented using Fahrenheit as unit,

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved

bit.name: Enable low alarm.
bit.description: Enable sending of low alarm events by setting this bit to one.

bit.name: Enable high alarm.
bit.description: Enable sending of high alarm events by setting this bit to one.

bit.name: Send TurnOn/TurnOff.
bit.description: Send TurnOn/TurnOff events instead of Alarm events by setting this bit to one. Bit 6 control when TurnOn/TurnOff events are sent.

bit.name: Controls when TurnOn/TurnOff events will be sent (if activated).
bit.description: 0 - TurnOn event is sent when low temperature is reached as set in low temperature alarm register. TurnOff event is sent when high temperature is reached as set in high temperature alarm register.\n 1 - TurnOff event is sent when low temperature is reached as set in low temperature alarm register. TurnOn event is sent when high temperature is reached as set in high temperature alarm register.\n The hysteresis value will effect TurnOn/TurnOff events The temperature must go above or below the hysteresis value before a new event will be sent out.

bit.name: Continuous alarm events.
bit.description: If this bit is set Alarm events will be sent continuous with a one second interval until the alarm register is read or the temperature goes to a non alarm state (with hysteresis taken into account). TurnOn/TurnOff events will not be affected by a cleared alarm register and will be sent until this bit is cleared or the temperature goes to a non alarm state (with hysteresis taken into account.

reg.name: HighControlRegisterSensor7
reg.description:
High control register for sensor 7.
 In the high sensor control register you can set functionality for the measurements of temperature 7.
 Bit 0: Report format (0=Integer, 1=Float, 2=String).
 Bit 1: Report format (0=Integer, 1=Float, 2=String).
 Bit 2: Reserved.
 Bit 3: Reserved.
 Bit 4: Reserved.
 Bit 5: Reserved.
 Bit 6: Reserved.
 Bit 7: Reserved.

bit.name: Report format
bit.description:
The module can present the temperatures in different formats. Default is as a float but you can select a normalised integer or a string instead.
 Set to 0 to set unit to Normalised integer.
 Set to 1 to set unit to Floating point (default).
 Set to 2 to set unit to String.

item.name: NormalisedInteger
item.description: Temperature is presented using a normalised integer value.

item.name: Float
item.description: Temperature is presented using a floating point value (default)

item.name: String
item.description: Temperature is presented using a string value.

reg.name: CalibrationSensor8_MSB

reg.name: CalibrationSensor8_LSB
reg.description: LSB of calibration value for sensor 8 (on-board sensor). Set a 16-bit signed value here to adjust the temperature readings up or down. The value should be the temperature adjustment expressed as temperature * 100.

reg.name: ChannelControlRegister
reg.description:
Channel control register.
 Set channel to search in lower nibble
 - Bit 0 set for search of sensors on channel 0.
 - Bit 1 set for search of sensors on channel 1.
 - Bit 2 set for search of sensors on channel 2.
 - Bit 3 set for search of sensors on channel 3.

 Set channel to send token activity in high nibble
 - Bit 4 set for token activity event sent for found sensor on channel 0.
 - Bit 5 set for token activity event sent for found sensor on channel 1.
 - Bit 6 set for token activity event sent for found sensor on channel 2.
 - Bit 7 set for token activity event sent for found sensor on channel 3.

bit.name: RomCodeFindChannel0
bit.description: Channel 0 ROM code find is performed if this register is written with this bit set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindChannel0
bit.description: Channel 1 ROM code find is performed if this register is written with this bit set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindChannel0
bit.description: Channel 2 ROM code find is performed if this register is written with this bit set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindChannel0
bit.description: Channel 3 ROM code find is performed if this register is written with this bit set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindReportChannel0
bit.description: CLASS1.INFORMATION, Type=37, Token activity events are sent for all found devices on channel 0. Note that the event is sent for all found not only the two temperature sensors that when found are placed in the ROM code array if the corresponding low nibble bit also is set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindReportChannel1
bit.description: CLASS1.INFORMATION, Type=37, Token activity events are sent for all found devices on channel 1. Note that the event is sent for all found not only the two temperature sensors that when found are placed in the ROM code array if the corresponding low nibble bit also is set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindReportChannel2
bit.description: CLASS1.INFORMATION, Type=37, Token activity events are sent for all found devices on channel 2. Note that the event is sent for all found not only the two temperature sensors that when found are placed in the ROM code array if the corresponding low nibble bit also is set.

bit.name: RomCodeFindReportChannel3
bit.description: CLASS1.INFORMATION, Type=37, Token activity events are sent for all found devices on channel 3. Note that the event is sent for all found not only the two temperature sensors that when found are placed in the ROM code array if the corresponding low nibble bit also is set.

bit.name: High alarm
bit.description: One or more of the sensors havs detected a high alarm condition. Write the register to reset the alarmflags.

bit.name: Low alarm
bit.description: One or more of the sensors havs detected a low alarm condition. Write the register to reset the alarmflags.

event.name: Temperature measurement Event (Normalised integer)
event.description: A periodic temperature measurement is sent out using this event. Can also be sent out after a CONTROL.SYNC event has been received by the module.

data.name: Format
data.description: This is one of the formats for measurement reports. Two other formats are available. It will tell (in bit 3,4) if the measurement is in unit Kelvin (0b00)/Celsius(0b01)/Fahrenheit unit(0b10). That the measurement value is a normalized integer (in bit 5,6,7 = 0b100) and from which sensor it is from (in bits 0,1,2).

data.name: Decimal point shift
data.description: Always 3. Divide by 1000. This byte tells how many steps left (for a positive number) or right (for a negative number) the decimal point should be shifted to get the correct temperature.

data.name: Temperature MSB
data.description: This is the most significant byte of the temperature.

data.name: Temperature
data.description: This is the middle byte of the temperature.

data.name: Temperature LSB
data.description: This is the least significant byte of the temperature.

event.name: Temperature measurement Event (float)
event.description: A periodic temperature measurement is sent out using this event. Can also be sent out after a CONTROL.SYNC event has been received by the module.

data.name: Format
data.description: This is one of the formats for measurement reports. Two other formats are available. It will tell (in bit 3,4) if the measurement is in unit Kelvin (0b00)/Celsius(0b01)/Fahrenheit unit(0b10). That the measurement value is a 24-bit floating point number (in bit 5,6,7 = 0b101) and from which sensor it is from (in bits 0,1,2).

data.name: Temperature MSB
data.description: First byte of the 24-bit floating point temperature value stored big-endian.

data.name: Temperature MSB
data.description: Second byte of the 24-bit floating point temperature value stored big-endian.

data.name: Temperature MSB
data.description: Third byte of the 24-bit floating point temperature value stored big-endian.

data.name: Temperature MSB
data.description: Last byte of the 24-bit floating point temperature value stored big-endian.

event.name: Temperature measurement Event (string)
event.description: A periodic temperature measurement is sent out using this event. Can also be sent out after a CONTROL.SYNC event has been received by the module.

data.name: Format
data.description: This is one of the formats for measurement reports. Two other formats are available. It will tell (in bit 3,4) if the measurement is in unit Kelvin (0b00)/Celsius(0b01)/Fahrenheit unit(0b10). That the measurement value as a string (in bit 5,6,7 = 0b010) and from which sensor it is from (in bits 0,1,2).

data.name: Temperature byte 1
data.description: Byte 1 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

data.name: Temperature byte 2
data.description: Byte 2 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

data.name: Temperature byte 3
data.description: Byte 3 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

data.name: Temperature byte 4
data.description: Byte 4 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

data.name: Temperature byte 5
data.description: Byte 5 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

data.name: Temperature byte 6
data.description: Byte 6 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

data.name: Temperature byte 7
data.description: Byte 7 of temperature string. The sting can be 1-7 bytes

event.name: Alarm Event
event.description: One of the temperature sensors have gone below the low alarm point or above the high alarm point.

data.name: Index
data.description: Index = 0 for sensor 0, 1 for sensor 1 ans so on.

data.name: Zone
data.description: This is the zone the sensor belongs to.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: This is the subzone the sensor belongs to.

event.name: TurnOn Event
event.description: One of the temperature sensors have gone below the low alarm point or above the high alarm point and it has been configured to send TurnOn/TurnOff events instead of alarm events.

data.name: Index
data.description: Index = 0 for sensor 0, 1 for sensor 1 ans so on.

data.name: Zone
data.description: This is the zone the sensor belongs to.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: This is the subzone the sensor belongs to.

event.name: TurnOff Event
event.description: One of the temperature sensors have gone below the low alarm point or above the high alarm point and it has been configured to send TurnOn/TurnOff events instead of alarm events.

data.name: Index
data.description: Index = 0 for sensor 0, 1 for sensor 1 ans so on.

data.name: Zone
data.description: This is the zone the sensor belongs to.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: This is the subzone the sensor belongs to.

event.name: Sync Event
event.description: The module send out temperature event(s) when a sync is received for the corresponding zone/subzone.

data.name: Index
data.description: This has no meaning for the module.

data.name: Zone
data.description: This is the zone the sensor belongs to which should send out a temperature event.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: This is the subzone the sensor belongs to which should send out a temperature event.

action.name: Scan
action.description: Scan for ROM codes for channel which have bit set.

param.name: Channel select bit-array
param.description: Set bit 1 to scan channel 0, bit 2 to scan channel 1 and so on.\n Several bits can be selected at the same time.

bit.name: Channel0
bit.description: Set this bit to one to scan channel 0.

bit.name: Channel1
bit.description: Set this bit to one to scan channel 1.

bit.name: Channel2
bit.description: Set this bit to one to scan channel 2.

bit.name: Channel3
bit.description: Set this bit to one to scan channel 3.

action.name: ScanAndStore
action.description: Scan for ROM codes for channel which have bit set and store result.

param.name: Channel select bit-array
param.description: Set bit 1 to scan channel 0, bit 2 to scan channel 1 and so on.\n Several bits can be selected at the same time.

bit.name: Channel0

bit.name: Channel2
bit.description: Set this bit to one to scan channel 2.

bit.name: Channel3
bit.description: Set this bit to one to scan channel 3.
